article.headline: Hereâs whatâs coming to Hulu in August 2020, and whatâs leaving
article.body: Hulu may not have many originals debuting in August 2020, but itâs adding enough action movies to make up for it. Next monthâs slim slate of originals including the Vince Vaughn comedy âThe Bingeâ (Aug. 28), a âPurgeâ parody where fun is banned, except for one day a year where everyone lets loose; âSlay the Dragonâ (Aug. 6), a political documentary about gerrymandering; Season 3 of the teen dramedy âFind Me in Parisâ (Aug. 21); and âThis Is Dominic Fike: The Next Big Thing?â (Aug. 7), a documentary produced in conjunction with FX and the New York Times about an obscure young musician whoâs given a $4 million record deal, and detailing the making of his first album and international tour. Thereâs also a smattering of bingeable favorites, like fresh seasons of âChopped,â âHouse Hunters Internationalâ and âNaked and Afraidâ (all Aug. 15). Also: What's coming in August to Netflix | Amazon Prime Video | HBO Max And more:Hereâs whatâs worth streaming in August 2020: âLovecraft Country,â âImmigration Nationâ and more And in this summer without movie blockbusters, the Walt Disney Co. DIS, +1.53% Â -controlled streaming service is also adding a bunch of older movies, including action-packed favorites such as â3:10 to Yuma,ââMaster and Commander: The Far Side of the World,â âTop Gun,â six âStar Trekâ films (all Aug. 1) and a pair of James Bond movies, âCasino Royaleâ and âQuantum of Solaceâ (both Aug. 31) Watch âem while you can, some of the new movie additions are also leaving at the end of the month. div.youtube { height:0; position:relative; padding-bottom:56.25%; } div.youtube > iframe { position: absolute; left: 0; top: 0; width: 100%; height:
